resources.string: This here is small sample app to show off Rhythm library and inspire you to use it. Don’t forget to check out its source code for complete experience.
Hey! Since you’re already judging, please report if you notice something out of rhythm (i.e. not aligned to 8dp/4dp grid), will you?
Take a moment to appreciate this beautifully laid out card.
Pull down the Notification shade to find Rhythm Quick Control. Loop through overlays for Activity background group. Then onto another groups. Knock yourself out!
Yay! 0.9.2 introduces declarative config, making building overlays a breeze. Examine the /res/raw/overlay_config to see how, or… Scratch that, try it out right here!

string-array.name: bullet_points
string-array.item: Horizontal and vertical grid lines, repeating at a fixed step. Combine two grid line layers to make a square grid.
Guides at arbitrary distance from specified view edge.
Inset groups to clip and offset nested layers.
Fill layers that can paint rectangular areas with uniform color to highlight margins.
Dimensions labels, to inspect views’ dimensions at glance.
More spec layer types coming soon!

resources.string: While controlling overlays from the notification is convenient, sometimes you simply don’t need it. With Rhythm you can explicitly create unlinked groups, new drawables and overlays, and assign them programmatically (see the source).

Thank you for following me to the end. If my calculations are correct, you should be in love with this library already, so why not support the developer? If you’re feeling generous, you can gift me a game on Steam, but simply telling your fellow developers about Rhythm or adding me to your circles is also awesome! Check out GitHub to find out how you can help. ♥
